I was recently having a conversation with an exam aspirant who wanted some guidance on how to improve his performance. He always found it difficult to complete the paper on time, and had to leave a lot of questions. On probing further, he mentioned that he had a “never give up” attitude. Once he took up a challenge, he always ensured that he saw it through. As a result, he found it very difficult to leave a question and move on to the next question. He kept on solving the same question for long, thus losing out on the speed. While having a “never give up” attitude is good, it is really important to also know where to apply that attitude. Sometimes, it is better to give up in order to achieve something better. Sometimes, it is better to prioritize your options and give up on the low priority options. One of the biggest errors we make in life is not accepting that we made a mistake. Economics calls it “sunk cost”. When you are working on a project, and you realize your efforts are not leading you anywhere, then you need to improvise and change the direction of your efforts. Improvisation does not necessarily mean giving up, but unfortunately, sometimes people shy away from improvising because they think it implies giving up. Having a “never give up” attitude is very useful when you are trying to achieve your goals, and you should definitely have that attitude. However, there are times when that attitude can lead to extremely negative results, and we need to be cognizant of those scenarios. We need to have a “never give up” attitude, but we also need to prioritize, need to be flexible, and need to improvise where needed. Sometimes, just sometimes, giving up is so much better than not giving up.

Awesome Question. This shall directly address those two famous quotes “never give up” and “Sometimes you should let things go”. In order to answer that, let’s create some parameters. What are the things for which the “you should never give up” attitude is vital ? They are probably things which are essential for your survival, growth and success. So this means : Never give up until you can finally crack the solution for that math problem.Never give up till you finally top the charts in your exams.Never give up till you have finally nailed that entrance.Never give up till you have finally landed your dream job.Never give up till you finally made your parents proud of.Never give up till you find your love of life.Never give up, till you finally look back to your past and smile about the fact that you never gave up.Now coming back to the parameters, than what are the things that don’t require this attitude : Give up for the friends that didn’t understand your value.Give up on the relatives, who no matter what you do, shall not appreciate you.Give up on the crowd, that is more than happy to term you as “Good for nothing”.Give up on that so called love, that is less a person and more like an onion for you.Give up on that crush, who you are aware of has no future, and might hinder activities that might frame it.The conclusion here being, You gotta decide the priorities, hit the right switches to turn on the needed bulb and shut down the troubling flashes. Prioritize and Execute, shall be the holy grail here. Am i supposed to cry out loud and keep dragging a relationship in which the other part is not feeling it as much as i am, Hell NO. So i let it go, completely, with no traces. Then, Am i supposed to sit down and conclude that i can’t do it, just because i am lacking on the financial grounds or may be am not as good as him, again, HELL NO. ! I keep striking back, until it hits the bulls eye. !

IIT-JEE, an examination well-known for the quality and difficulty level of questions. Most of us know about it. I’ll tell you the story related to it. He hailed from a small tribal village in Rajasthan called Jalore. He got his education in Hindi medium and hadn’t got much exposure to the tough, cut-throat competition. In 2000, he wrote IIT-JEE for the first time. Result- Failed to qualify. After this failure, many would have run away from the competition. But he didn’t. He came to Kota, the coaching capital of India and took admission in a coaching institute to prepare for IIT-JEE again. He was, as if lost amongst the brilliant English-speaking students of Kota. Come 2001 and he wrote IIT-JEE again. Result- Failed to qualify again. A second failure would have surely crushed the hopes and determination of many. But not this guy. He came back to Kota and began preparing again in a different coaching institute. He was an unknown name there. Now comes 2002 and he sat for IIT-JEE for the third time. After the results of IIT-JEE 2002 were out, the coaching institutes faced a strange problem. None of the heavy-weight coaching institutes of Kota, including the one in which he was studying could find the AIR-1 in their top rankers’ lists. A lot of hulabaloo followed. Finally, someone from a mediocre batch of a coaching institute in Kota announced that he was the AIR 1. The coaching institutes had never even considered his name due to not belonging to a top batch. He was a surprise package. But what about our protagonist’s result. Yes, you guessed it right. Result- All India Rank “1” He was that unknown, underestimated Dark Horse!!! Inspiring right? The “He” here is none other than Mr. Dungara Ram Choudhary, a popular name in the coaching circles of Kota.  If someone wants an example of a person with a never-give-up attitude, his is the first name that comes to my mind.He had great determination and self-belief to qualify the IIT-JEE. He kept trying again and again, once, twice, thrice and finally qualified it. Not just qualified it. But nailed the AIR 1, a mere dream for thousands. So, what I think is a never-give-up attitude really helps in the long run of life. In short term, it may sound foolish and you may be joked about. But if you succeed, you’ll be remembered and become an example for many. But what if fail? You’ll not be able to achieve your ultimate goal through that road. But the lessons you learn and qualities you acquire will still surely come handy in taking you to your final destination. So, DON’T STOP TRYING. -PK

No!! Not always. I've read too many success stories of never giving up to this question. But sometimes letting go is better than never give up. Some less told stories here:  This boy here  Sachin Tendulkar visited MRF Pace Foundation Chennai in 1987 because he wanted to become a fast bowler. As abackup plan his brother carried his batting kit along. By watching his batting skills on the net Australian bowler Dennis Lille insisted him to stick to that. But boy was quite firm on what he wanted to become. 2 years later this teenager made his test debut, and rest is as they say history. If he never gave up we would still be searching for GOD.   Everyone knows the story of this man  A scene from the movie M.S Dhoni an untold story. Cricket coach of his schools notices his goal keeping skills one day and sends a boy to M.S to ask whether he is interested in cricket. Boy rerurns to the coach with the answer, Arre pagal hai kya,Chote ball se kaun khelta hai..! ( are you mad? Who'll play with that tiny ball?) And you know what happened further. If he hadn't given up his goal keeping we wouldn't have witnessed a great wicket keeper in cricket history and a Captain cool.   So here is the bottom line. No! Never give up is not always right . Sometimes letting go does less damage than holding on.  Cheers!!

You have a plethora of different answers to this question Sanjana, and so after divulging everybody's input you have to make up your own mind which answers you truly value and feel most comfortable with. From my perspective I have been fortunate to have lived 69 years on this earth, and I must tell you I am not from the 'never give up' stable in life.  No.  It does not always work.  Honestly.  I have come across stories of people who have lost everything because they did not have the intuition or sensibility to quit when the time showed itself to be right for quitting.  With some people it is a case that their pride gets in the way.  With others it may be them trying to prove a point.  Others still, greed takes charge and throws logic out of the window.  One has to take these points seriously in life because they happen! What I would tell you personally, is to banish the 'never give up' phrase or may be add in a word to make it 'never give up easily'.  That puts a different perspective on it. 'Never give up' is just a catch phrase.  Never give up your motivation, may be.  Never give up your commitment to make your life meaningful.  But acquire the capacity to know when you should not give up and when you definitely should.  Now that would make sense to me.

As a part of our college curriculum, we were all assigned group projects. My group was assigned a specific topic and in order to start with it, we designed our own method, let's call it the method 'X'. For about two months we worked very hard, tried to modify it, but it did not give the desired results. Our guide suggested that we give up on this method 'X' and start afresh. It was so difficult to give up on it because we worked so hard, for two months! How could we just discard it? But discarding it was (unfortunately :P ) the wise choice. Giving up on that method and starting all over again was important, because the main goal was to complete the project! Finally, we came up with an approach 'Y', and this did work. What I wish to convey here is that it is important to work hard, very hard, to achieve your goal. And obviously, there will be a lot of obstacles on the way. Not giving up on your goal is one part of your journey. The other part is the methodology that you undertake in order to deal with the obstacles. Not giving up on the goal should be your main aim… But giving up on traditional beliefs and certain approaches that might have worked for you in the past, can actually be beneficial for you to achieve your desired results!

I think this question appeared on my feed at the right time. I had my CS Professional exam results today. I couldn’t clear it. If I talk about my CS statistics, I have cleared all the levels till now in the very first attempt and not being able to crack it in Finals was a shock. The results were to be announced at 11:00 am. And as soon as it flashed upon the screen, it took me a while to realise the word ‘FAIL’ on marksheet. Naturally, I cried, got anxious, negative thoughts made their own good space. Everyone consoled but couldn’t help it out. In the evening, met my Faculty where I did my coaching for the same. Somewhere between his words and my hopeless mind, he just told me one line- ‘You know its a step back for a long jump. You have two choices, either continue crying and affect the next attempt or accept the fact and fight back as a warrior with double power.’ It was in few moments that I finally understood his words, and realised that I was wasting my time by crying on something that isn’t in my hand anymore. “No more crying. Get back to work, Drishti!”, I spoke to myself. And here I am writing this answer, the “never give up” attitude is on. Is it helpful? I don’t know. All I know is the world doesn’t stop by a failure, rather its the beginning of a success journey. May be something great is waiting for me. May be this was not meant to be. May be I needed to learn the value of a failure in life which I never did. With all the positive attitude, I continue my journey with double the power and courage. I can and I will!

Purush Raj aka Rakesh basically from Rae Bareli, UP, 48 years old man. He is renting second hand books in Andheri(East), Mumbai, 300 meter from Seven hills hospital. He had a major accident when he was 15 years old and he lost his left hand. 15th august 1985, he has gone for pluck mango with his younger brother who was demanding for mango. Rakesh climbed tree, he was not aware that high voltage wires crossing above his head. Unluckily he stood between two wires, his left hand and left side of head touched that wire. He was unconscious about that fact, he didn’t even realize what’s happening. he said his younger brother recalled this incident to him. After 3 days his consciousness back at Zila hospital, UP. Doctor said his hand had to cut us so that poison couldn’t spread in whole body. He was married that time but “gauna” didn’t happen (child Marriage), he said to his wife,”Marry with someone else who could take care of you because I couldn’t.” Her reply take you to romantic movie of bollywood. She said,” ladki ki shaadi ekbaar hoti hai. Main aapki hi ban ke rahungi.” His motivation to fight with circumstances and problem occur against him was his wife. He has 3 Kids now. One is married and settled with his wife. He hadn’t regret for that. He did lots of agriculture works in delhi and then came to Mumbai. One more tragedy happened his mind gone unbalanced, then he went back home, after 4-5 months when he recovered . He had gone Delhi and done same agricultural work but his destiny took him to Mumbai again and started book renting stall. 15-16 years completed renting books. I asked him,” Do you face loss, if someone keep your book instead of returning?”Positivity in height, He said,” I took 100 to 300 in advance from readers depending on which book he or she renting and book had already circulated 2-3 times at least. So i recovered money. Now he is Wikipedia of books, he remembered all books name with writer name and he will customize your wishlist means after one or two books he will know your inclination towards genre of books and he can start suggesting books on that genre. I can’t tell about others but I am learning art of living because of his suggested books. Dr. Abdul Kalam once said,” One best book is equal to hundred good friends but one good friend is equal to a library.” I didn’t find library yet but I have books to shape my life. I am adding one sentence on that quote is, ” That good friend must have read 100 books.”

Oh boy it certainly works! Disclaimer - NOT Claiming always part of the question Here’s my story illustrated below and you judge on whether never giving up is the right strategy forward in any situation. My background first - This is 2014, I have had troubles in my personal life with family related health problems which used to keep me occupied with thoughts as I was away from my family pursuing B.Tech in ECE at NITK Surathkal in India. I might discuss my life before this period on another day. There was a program which our college was hosting known as NITK CMU Winterschool which was going to be held in December 2014. As I continued learning more about the program and getting exited at the thought of meeting one of world’s best faculty and applied to the program in the hopes of getting into the program. Fortunately, I did get selected in the program and it was an amazing experience [more on this in a separate post] and met wonderful people in the span of 15 days to turn in quality research projects in the period. And this marks the beginning of the kick [I have never taken drugs in my life but I am sure it was a similar feeling that one would get], I got with research. Considering the financial situation, I decided to wait for a period of a year-two and decided to work at ARM [a brilliant experience there by the way]. So right now you must be thinking heck everything is working out in your life. I did continue working on the research while working at ARM and did my best to contribute in the best possible way staying in collaboration and touch with researchers at CMU. GRE and TOEFL Attempt 1 So, in the first year itself, as a goal to get into one of the best Computer Science schools, I decided to give the standardized tests which almost every applicant has to give to get into a good schools. I got a low GRE score and an even worse TOEFL score [lets not talk about it]. This came as a jolt to me as I really wanted to apply that year itself and didn't want to miss out. However, it was clear to me thinking rationally that I will get rejected in most schools which I really wanted to be a part of. Thus, I didn't apply to any schools that year - more like accepting defeat - and this was a decision which I took given the financial amount one has to shell out for applications. Now, I know that the dream destination is at least one year away and this time I wanted to be better prepared and you know like stay ahead of the usual timelines and thus, started studying for GRE in month of February when I was targetting of giving the exam in July so that I get enough time to write TOEFL and get a good score on the exam - a reasonable decision to take at that time. Starting early did give me motivation to stay on track with GRE prep and always remember the goal in mind. I stayed focused throughout the period and prepared diligently for the exam alongside staying on top of work at ARM as well as pursuing research. It was one of those moments when you see your friends going out to parties and enjoying their lives and you are sitting in the same room working stuff out in the hope of getting a good score in tests. The TEST Day - I tried hard to not bring back any memories of the previous times and went into the exam hall in confidence. I came out of the exam knowing that I had screwed up and will have to give the third attempt. I had atleast hoped that my score will improve by a few points on that day. However, fate had some other thoughts for me. I got the same exact aggregate score of Verbal and Quants which meant that I got less than 170 in Quants as I had a perfect score in the previous attempt. Since the verbal score was so low, below cutoff scores for most programs that I had to really work on improving my English skills needed for the task. I knew that I am not that bad in English as the test portrayed me to be in comparison with others. Thus, with a heavy heart and constantly spending 200$ on an exam I decided to give another attempt in GRE - a third time and this time with even more hours of work put in. GRE Attempt - 3 BIG TIME FAILED as I took break from my office work and used up most leaves granted for 10 days straight in this attempt. Got an improvement of just two points in the GRE exam and mind you all this while my TOEFL exam was getting delayed as it was almost 15th August and I hadn't given an attempt on TOEFL yet. So, I delayed the GRE exam for another attempt post giving the TOEFL exam. It is not that I am a rich person who could afford these many attempts but I had to weight in the risk involved with a failed attempt VS the rewarding experience in later stages. Realizing the mistakes made in past attempts with TOEFL exam. I read up online about how to go about preparing for the exam. Most sources said that Notefull is one of the best preparation material in addition to the official guides from ETS. Hence, I requested a friend of mine to provide access to Notefull as I couldn't afford spending amount on material for the exam. I went into the exam on August 27th fully prepared and was super excited to remove TOEFL off the checklist. TOEFL Attempt 1. First section went well which was the writing section for me. In the second section - Listening section, the audio suddenly went mute, I was in shock as to what happened as the audio clip was running out and there was no sound whatsoever. So I raised hand to call the assistant to help me with the problem since the complete section of audio had run out and it was time for me to answer questions based on the audio. I requested the organizers to check the error and reset back the audio. They restart the system twice, call their software provider and waste 15 mins of time in the middle of an exam where concentration is the key. I somehow kept my calm after the assistant asked me to randomly mark the answers at the moment since they had no control of exam if overall time of 3 hrs and 45 mins runs out and regardless of the section the exam would terminate. Heartbroken, I prayed to the almighty to get me some correct answers out of the randomly marked answers, however the complete section was without audio and out of 30 questions, I was forced to mark 24 based on fluke. I did get 12/30 eventually so some of the 24 fluke I did get them correct. However, coming out of the exam post arguing with the exam organizers and getting an assurance of redemption if I email the ETS company - [which was a painful process as I would have sent about 20 -25 emails exchanges with about an hour speaking with customer center to explain the issue]. With 12/30 on listening, 26 reading, 27 writing and 24 speaking - no schools where I wanted to get in was going to accept me in their program. So I knew now I had GRE attempt 4 and TOEFL attempt 2 to be given. TOEFL Attempt 2 Immediately after going home post failed attempt 1 - with no fault of mine, I was like why this is happening with me and all that sort of things one say to themselves when such event happens. Out of 250 students at that time, two students faced this software bug as it turns out that ETS was upgrading TOEFL software with new way to transmit audio and make their application lightweight. Now this time thinking that I was smart. I decided not to go itself to that center and rather take a new center hoping that it will bring me good luck and with those cliche thoughts - I went ahead and booked TOEFL in a new center. You will not believe - The center this time was small and now in a months period in September it was this centers turn with the new software update. Out of 69 students, I was the only student who was affected with the problem and the assistant there was helpless again. This time though post coming out of the exam with a dismal listening section, I spoke with the members conducting the exam and requested them to call ETS rightaway with the issues faced. It was a Saturday and at 5pm ETS was not reachable and so I was doomed and returned back home - - REALLY REALLY FRUSTRATED this time. Two days went by with the same depressed feeling on what is going on and the WHY ME mentality. I gathered myself seeing the dream goal which seemed like going away at this point of time. GRE Attempt 4 After receiving a score of 92 on the test with 13 in listening section, I wrote the test for the third attempt - again with the same money which I had paid for the first attempt as ETS acknowledged the error and sent a SORRY email which really I didn't care about at that time since their software was the reason for me feeling doubtful and doubting my own abilities. So this time, it was my turn to screw things up in the exam in month of October where I was unable to prepare well for the exam and overall leading to a minor 4 points improvement in the exam. However with 1 point improvement in the Analytical writing section since by this time I had read the GRE official responses atleast 5 - 6 times and written tens of essays in similar lines with efficient practice. My GRE score was still below par but since it was in 320 ball park - the score was acceptable in top universities with exceptional things on other parts of application. I wrote to universities to get a sense of whether my verbal score is acceptable since my Quant score was 169 - sufficient for almost all schools one wants to apply for. Some universities politely asked me not to apply itself as there is a minor chance of consideration of such applications below cutoff. Now I was 1 point below cutoff. That HURTS. However, I thank them today as it saved me application fees :P It was mid- October by this time. Then comes TOEFL another attempt. TOEFL attempt 3 - October 27 By this time my confidence in my abilities had started to diminish and I had to get atleast score of 100 as without that score I will miss applications ending on November 15. So, October end along with a major delivery at ARM, and submission of a research paper [To have strong points on other parts of application], I prepared for TOEFL and went into the exam hoping to clear the bare minimum of 100 points so that I can apply. This time I screwed it up and I sort of knew that I did worse than expected. I waited for 12 days just to learn that my score was 98. Could you believe it? In the meantime of 12 days, I had been to my college to request professors for recommendations and knew that 15th November I was cutting down on the university list. Thus, in desperation of getting positive response from some university on whether they are willing to relax 100 minimum bar requirement for TOEFL, I had to give up on my applications for 15th November for a few universities. This brought a change in my application list - meaning I need to realistically work on which universities is possible to get in and regardless of any matter I knew that I had to apply into CMU as it was my dream college and it is not going to change. One word - MORE work and even less time as TOEFL attempt 4 is pending and CMU looks an even more ambitious goal as I received response from CMU that 100 requirement is sort of mandatory and relaxed in extremely rare cases - which is also mentioned on their website in one corner. TOEFL attempt 4 This time I waited for my salary to come back before booking the next date which turned out to be a huge mistake as November 25th slots were filled. So my last last chance for the year was on December 2nd and I was working hard as crazy at this point of time. Didnt think of anything but just dreamed of CMU and how much getting there meant for me. I worked at office and even slacked at this point with my deliveries. However couldnt slack at lot as I knew that December 7–15 I definitely have to slack in office work. My leaves are used up and thus maintained utmost focus in office hours and ensured that within 8 hours all the work was done. Then went back - worked on research work with another publication in mind and TOEFL score, Statement of purpose, creating a website and stayed up late till 3–4 am and back to reset next day at 9am with 10 am in office and repeated this for the complete month almost with two days - NO SLEEP. I knew that this was the DO it or GET LOST moment for me from the universities applications and did my best to get a good score in TOEFL. Things went as expected, I still thought that something was missing and was not very happy with the result. However, I knew that 100 will be crossed successfully in the back of my mind. So I gathered myself sending out reminder mails to professors for recommendation, working on the Statement of purpose getting feedback as much as possible and even went to the get external paid support from Admission Table to receive feedback. Frankly, I did get good advice on style of writing and met one of the best persons whom I bonded with advisor at Admission table who gave me advice on NOT to apply to 10 universities in November. His viewpoint - Given the amount of time, don’t spend your time in 10 applications as lets say you have 500 hours and you divide it by 10 you have 50 on one application assuming equal importance as one has to draft Statement of purpose accordingly and catered towards a university. If you apply to only 6 universities - 500/6 -will give you 83 hours. Additional 33 hours which looks like you are adding time to your application and thereby having a much stronger applications. I took the simple math calculation as it made sense as all I wanted to work out was that one application with dream application at CMU. One of my professors told me during the visit - Ankit apply only to those places where you really want to get into. Don’t apply just for sake of applying - You will regret this decision a few years down the line. I consider myself lucky that I got such rich advice and amazing professors who stood by me and provided recommendation letters in time. A big thank you to them for their support. Things did work out as I got well above 100 in TOEFL with 26 in speaking score. Follow great mentors - I am lucky to have few great mentors whom I don’t want to name publicly. I am grateful to almighty for having found them. So NEVER GIVE UP!It was the worst of times and took the best of courage and effort to get out of the situation. After 8 attempts I realized - One thing that always yields results is the ATTITUDE to NEVER GIVE UP and go after your dreams TIRELESSLY. Update: - I wrote this answer to recollect my strengths as I did screw up and didn’t perform to the best of my abilities in the first semester and reminding myself that you have gone through worse times than this - So NEVER GIVE UP. KEEP being the best version of yourself and Go ahead to create your own LUCK.
